Use case

Enhancing Career Growth 

COMPANY

Insulet

INDUSTRY

Medical Devices

DURATION

12 Months

ROLE PLAYED

UX Design Manager and Six Sigma Green Belt

Leveraging Six Sigma and Service Design Methodologies

Introduction

In the dynamic world of User Experience, managing larger teams with varying levels of engagement and diverse skill sets presents unique challenges. This was the situation within the UX organization at Insulet Corporation, where navigating a mix of talent of over fifty individuals across five disciplines, amidst conflicting motivations, required innovative solutions and collaborative leadership.

Outcome

In navigating the challenges of diverse remote teams, managers and teams joined forces to craft solutions. Trust was cultivated through open dialogue, as teams shared their aspirations, met with supportive responses from managers. A scalable approach emerged, featuring an internal site for easy resource access, showcasing several new initiatives empowering the team to take ownership, guided by experienced, trustworthy, and supportive UX leadership.

Process

After conducting a thorough analysis of Insulet’s engagement survey data spanning from 2022 to 2023, it became evident that career growth remained an area requiring attention. Recognizing the need for a cohesive approach, I strategically implemented a blend of Six Sigma and Service Design methodologies. This initiative aimed to foster open dialogue and active participation among managers from various disciplines and over 50 team members, regardless of their seniority or background, in order to collaboratively devise solutions to enhance career growth opportunities.

Discovery and Problem Definition:

Rather than implementing top-down directives, the process began with an anonymous survey customized for our teams, followed by personalized one-on-one sessions. This ensured that responses were aligned with the UX organization, which had recently undergone reorganization and expanded to include two additional disciplines: Human Factors and Instructional Design, in addition to the existing User Research, Design, and Technical Writing.

The results revealed detailed needs and pain points in the current experience. Using these insights, I defined personas and behavioral segments, generated the SIPOC process, current and future customer journey. This approach proved effective as it acknowledged the diverse behaviors and motivations of the team, from associates to staff members. It also revealed additional demands, but it was necessary to prioritize those related to career growth.

Measure:

Aligning with the gathered information, I collaborated with UX leadership to establish key performance indicators (KPIs) related to process and structure clarification, infrastructure development, as well as incentives, to enhance overall team’s satisfaction.

Analyze:

I facilitated the identification of root causes and areas for improvement using fishbone diagrams and the 5 Whys method. The UX management supported the ongoing validation of ideas with the team to enhance career path experiences, aligning with HR initiatives aimed at individual professional development.

Central to this approach was fostering a culture of collaboration and mutual respect, encouraging active participation from all members. This environment of psychological safety and trust enabled constructive interactions and collective problem-solving. At the manager level, I advocated for scalable solutions leveraging the strengths of five UX managers and other professionals at Insulet, ensuring stable and accessible resources for the team.

Improve:

I developed and implemented a plan to enhance processes, incorporating Six Sigma methodologies for efficiency and quality. Although challenging to find time for implementation amid daily tasks, it was gratifying to witness team members collaborating and contributing enthusiastically.

Some of the initiatives undertaken included the establishment of a new intranet site serving as a comprehensive resource hub with quick links and how-to guides. This site provided recommendations for courses, certifications, and conferences for formal training. Furthermore, we curated recordings and interviews from subject matter experts, along with insights from team members on courses they've taken.

We facilitated opportunities to run or join training watch parties, as well as access mentoring resources for various formats such as one-on-one, group, or peer mentoring. Lastly, we offered learning-by-doing opportunities to engage in existing projects as UX professionals within the company, and encouraged project proposals through easy-to-follow guides.

Prototype and Test:

We built and ran tests using prototypes, interviews and other resources, validating the improved experience. Testing early facilitated iterative design improvements.

Implementation:

We rolled out finalized improvements, prioritizing proper training and support for staff, aligning with the mid-year engagement survey timeline.

Control:

Establishing control measures linked to KPIs ensured ongoing performance monitoring and maintenance of quality standards. This initiative aimed to empower individuals to navigate their growth trajectories, guided by UX leadership, and was designed to be continuously improved by the team.

Conclusion:

Managing professional growth in a diverse, remote, and expansive UX team poses both challenges and opportunities for advancement and innovation. Employing an integrated strategy that merges systematic problem-solving and iterative design principles with a scalable mindset has yielded positive results. This approach is driving collective success through tailored yet scalable initiatives, inclusivity, and measurable outcomes.
